CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 7, 1940 reads: "Concrete Proof That Courier Is Winning Its Fight - At left are pictures taken at Fort Bragg, North Carolina, where Negro soldiers are being trained for the first time in Coast Artillery technique...Bottom photo shows the type of mechanized machinery the 77th and 76th Regiments are learning how to use at Fort Bragg. Photos by Harris"
TitMainTitle: Two soldiers seated on a piece of military machinery, Fort Bragg, North Carolina
CatSubject_tab: Men--North Carolina--Fort Bragg.Fort Bragg (N.C.)Vehicles, Military--North Carolina--Fort Bragg.
